<a id="class_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc"></a>

# VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc

**Inherits:** [VisualShaderNode](class_visualshadernode.md) **<** [Resource](class_resource.md) **<** [RefCounted](class_refcounted.md) **<** [Object](class_object.md)

Calculates a derivative within the visual shader graph.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

This node is only available in ``Fragment`` and ``Light`` visual shaders.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<a id="enum_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_Precision"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **Precision**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_Precision)

<a id="class_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_constant_PRECISION_NONE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Precision](class_visualshadernodederivativefunc.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_Precision) **PRECISION_NONE** = `0`

No precision is specified, the GPU driver is allowed to use whatever level of precision it chooses. This is the default option and is equivalent to using ``dFdx()`` or ``dFdy()`` in text shaders.<a id="class_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_constant_PRECISION_COARSE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Precision](class_visualshadernodederivativefunc.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_Precision) **PRECISION_COARSE** = `1`

The derivative will be calculated using the current fragment's neighbors (which may not include the current fragment). This tends to be faster than using [PRECISION_FINE](class_visualshadernodederivativefunc.md#class_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_constant_PRECISION_FINE), but may not be suitable when more precision is needed. This is equivalent to using ``dFdxCoarse()`` or ``dFdyCoarse()`` in text shaders.<a id="class_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_constant_PRECISION_FINE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Precision](class_visualshadernodederivativefunc.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_Precision) **PRECISION_FINE** = `2`

The derivative will be calculated using the current fragment and its immediate neighbors. This tends to be slower than using [PRECISION_COARSE](class_visualshadernodederivativefunc.md#class_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_constant_PRECISION_COARSE), but may be necessary when more precision is needed. This is equivalent to using ``dFdxFine()`` or ``dFdyFine()`` in text shaders.<a id="class_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_constant_PRECISION_MAX"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Precision](class_visualshadernodederivativefunc.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_Precision) **PRECISION_MAX** = `3`

Represents the size of the [Precision](class_visualshadernodederivativefunc.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_Precision) enum.<hr class="classref-section-separator">

<a id="class_VisualShaderNodeDerivativeFunc_property_precision"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

<!-- classref-property-setget -->
